programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals wage a covert war for survival, deploying their hidden weapons with deadly precision. These adaptations, forged by eons of evolution, give animals the edge they need to outwit predators, rivals, and the elements. From the bombardier beetle's boiling spray to the mantis shrimp's explosive club and the draco lizard‚Äôs hidden wings, meet nature's awesome secret weapons.

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Snakes
programme.desc: The Indo-pacific is home to some of the world's fastest striking vipers, enormous pythons and the king of cobras. Find out which is most dangerous!.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol has helped kids show animals at the county fair for more than 40 years. For some families, its a tradition going back generations. Raising fair animals takes months of work, and it all pays off at showtime! At the clinic, Doc helps a limping steer with a swollen leg, Dr. Brenda treats a urinary blockage that threatens a cats kidneys, and Dr. Lisa bandages a wounded dog.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Its Mothers Day! Dr. Pol and Dr. Brenda rush to the aid of animals struggling to give birth, while Dr. Lisa treats a cow suffering from a postpartum emergency. Two puppies get poked for their vaccines, and two older dogs come in with quills stuck all over their bodies. As Mothers Day approaches, Doc and Charles cook up a special treat for Diane and Beth. .

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: In the wild, animals face life or death battles every day, from escaping deadly predators to fighting off fierce rivals. Sometimes brute force isn‚Äôt enough to prevail. Survival can depend on death-defying acrobatics, secret senses and hidden weapons - the extraordinary superpowers that help animals survive.

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Snakes
programme.desc: The Indo-pacific is home to some of the world's fastest striking vipers, enormous pythons and the king of cobras. Find out which is most dangerous!.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals survive by using camouflage, mimicry, and stealth tactics. From tigers who hunt in plain sight using their orange fur as camouflage, and a spider who mimics an ant to sneak into a colony, to a bird that uses false alarm calls to trick meerkats into giving up their prey, nature deploys remarkable deception to survive.

programme.title: Madagascar's Weirdest
programme.desc: Madagascar's creatures have developed some of the strangest survival methods Mother Nature has to offer..

programme.title: Madagascar's Weirdest
programme.desc: Madagascar is an island nation set adrift for millions of years, leaving its wildlife in extreme isolation and causing some bizarre adaptations. Many of the creatures here are found nowhere else on earth. From the feared fossa to the mysterious aye-aye, and a variety of lemurs, in Madagascar, being weird is a way of life.
